website_summaries.verdict: Can't decide between a cot and an air mattress? Get the best of both with this queen-size air bed and steel frame cot.
pros: Sturdy steel cot supports up to 600 pounds
Can accommodate people up to 6-foot 2-inches tall
Cot can be used without mattress

customer_reviews.title: Can be used for more than sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I just want to let you all know what most of you might be wondering.. Can you make sweet love on this bed? Well the answer is YES yes you can! My significant other and I are both large tall people, we both slept comfortably on this bed. Recommended for both activities!
customer_reviews.author: Katorade

customer_reviews.title: updated after a year
customer_reviews.text: Well we've camped a using this cot approximately 8 times total. The air matress won't hold air so I replaced it with another Coleman matress still no good. Completely flat before the night is over! They need to come out with a pad for the top. Here's the issue this cot holds a lot of weight (2 adults) more weight then an air matress. It's worthless after a few uses go with a cot that has a pad
customer_reviews.author: Datsmymom

customer_reviews.title: Mattress sucks. Cot is nice.
customer_reviews.text: The cot part is neat. The air mattress that comes with this bed sucks. I ended up giving away the one that comes with it and going to buy a really nice one. It is almost like coleman expects you to do that because the casing that zips over the airbed is extra large for a thicker mattress. Once I bought the thicker better mattress, being able to set it up off the ground on this cot feature is really nice. Easier for an older person to not have to get down on the grown.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna White

customer_reviews.title: Comfort for camping and home!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the BEST things ever!!! Bought two of these for a camping trip, but these are so nice that they are great for house guests. They blow up easily and the zippered pocket keeps the mattress in place. The cots have plastic feet that will not damage your tent floor! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Deal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make use of our den as a spare bedroom and slept on it last night. Set up was straightforward and the inflator worked as described, I also purchased a 2" memory foam topper and a regular twin mattress pad to for insulation in the winter and to give the bed a more conventional look and feel. It was more comfortable than any air mattress I have ever slept on! Not noisy at all and surprisingly comfortable...and the height was perfect too! If you like a really firm mattress the topper probably wouldn't be a good idea. Overall, a great purchase and wouldn't hesitate to buy another if the need arose.
customer_reviews.author: Iminocca

customer_reviews.title: deflating
customer_reviews.text: keeps deflating, there are no holes at all im trying to return it now. Just bought it for my mom when she visits and we inflated it and it is clearly defective, it wont stay inflated through the day. ( we are not over-weight).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.text: Our first trip with this bed was great. It stayed inflated through the night. Comfortably fit my husband, 3-year-old daughter and myself. Being elevated off the ground made the camping experience a little VIP. 😃 One drawback is that it is pretty heavy BUT it is an acceptable trade-off for a sturdy bed in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty for a heavy dude...
customer_reviews.text: I slept on one of these every night for 4 months. I was thoroughly impressed not only with how comfortable it was, but how durable. I am not a small person, and it took everything I threw at it. Excellent investment in camping comfort!
customer_reviews.author: IAN MC PHERSON

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, queen size fitted sheet fits well. Holds my husband of 220 and I very nicely. You will enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: Terri W

customer_reviews.title: Not up to 400lb rated.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be the answer to my camping needs. 400 pounds. Back problems. Surely a 600lbs rated top of the line $144 cot and air mattress combo would make the definitive camping experience. Not at all. The middle bar has 2 feet on each side of the cot. Both snapped like twigs. My purchase rendered null. I am entirely disappointed and will not be buying another coleman product. Im just destroyed i wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike VonDoom

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: I have returned this item. It set up fairly easily, but the pump is a joke. I had to finish blowing this up with my mouth because it would not fully inflate. Even when inflated as much as I could, when I lay on my back, I am laying on the frame. I weigh 165 and could not find a single spot on this bed where I was supported at all. I even tried deflating and re-inflating and no change.If you want a cot, sure, buy this. If you want an air mattress with a semblance of support, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Daiquiri

customer_reviews.title: All the comforts of a bed
customer_reviews.text: If you're on the fence about buying this, don't delay! I literally made a mini bedroom in my tent. Setup and takedown is easy. Fantastic nights of sleeping in the wild.
customer_reviews.author: MoDub

customer_reviews.title: SO noisy and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: So VERY disappointed! Noisiest mattress we’ve ever used. Tried taking it out of sheet sleeve which reduced noise a little, but was just horrible to sleep on. Thank heavens we tried it before my 74 year old dad arrived! Pump is also underpowered...cannot fill mattress properly. I purchased an electric pump to see if it made mattress any more comfortable. While it filled properly, still dreadful back ache in the morning. Such a pity - so many rave reviews. Sigh. The actual cot is very sturdy and side tables are a great idea....just can’t get a good night’s sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerless
customer_reviews.text: Air mattress was ordered for guest room and camping. First off, mattress is not queen size, or at least we found standard queen sheets to be too big. Second, because the mattress is attached to the cot, you cannot tuck in sheets. Not an issue if you're using sleeping bags. Finally, we returned the product because the air pump does not have enough power to completely inflate the mattress. Once almost full, no more air gets pushed in, seems as if air is pushed out faster than pump can push in.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Reeds

customer_reviews.title: No good. Such a frustrating mattress like every other air ...
customer_reviews.text: No good. Such a frustrating mattress like every other air mattress I've used. AeroBed or whatever, they all deflate while you sleep and you end up sinking into it. The included pump is so loud, re-inflating in the middle of the night simply isn't an option. And when you roll in your sleep, every tent around you can hear you move - fully-inflated or not. So annoying. It's also quite heavy when packed. All that vinyl adds up in weight. I will say that the built-in cover to hold the mattress in place was a nice feature. Unfortunately, after this one, I'm giving up on air mattresses completely.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip U.

customer_reviews.title: Remarkably Good! Five Stars!
customer_reviews.text: The build quality, ease of use, and overall comfort of the Coleman Queen-size Camping Cot are remarkably good. We've used it for three weeks straight as we get ready to move and it has been great! Prior to bedding down for the night -- and as stated in the instructions -- we touched up the air pressure using the supplied pump as the air mattress "settled in" during the first few days. After that, we've given it a quick, minor boost (60 seconds or less) every few days. It's extremely convenient and "user friendly." We wouldn't hesitate to use it as a guest bed, for camping, or even visiting where sleeping arrangements are limited. It's a first-class asset.
customer_reviews.author: Design & Fabrication

customer_reviews.title: Comfy bed but....
customer_reviews.text: This bed was actually more comfortable that I thought it would be! The only negative thing it has is the terrible noise it made everytime someone moved. It was a terrible plastic rubbing against plastic noise. Like when you rub a balloon, so cringy that it woke everyone up whenever someone changed positions. We recommend not putting the mattress under the cover it comes with and instead using your own cover for it so it won't make that noise. The nightstand type attachments with cup holders were great! we loved them because we could put our drink and keys, phones on there. Overall, this cot/air mattress combo is great with a few changes to the setup. :)
customer_reviews.author: jros

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality cott and mattress. Pump, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: The cott is very nice and the mattress seems to be good as well. However, the electric pump was physically damaged. The battery cover clips were bent, the plastic is damaged and the on/off switch was in pieces. I was able to get the cover on and had to rig the switch to turn it on. Need the cott immediately so could not box it all up for return just because of the pump.
customer_reviews.author: TSad

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed! :(
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to use this bed during our camping trip. We tried at home and the unfold / fold was very easy and the inflating / deflating was easy as well. But then, when we actually used it in the camping: - the mattress got deflated half way through out the night - the frame was squicking non stop - there was a lot of fabric pieces coming out - one of the zippers broke out Really not what we were expecting. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: L3V

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Two reasons that I did not give five stars is because I wish you could lock the frame when it is set up and the air mattress that comes with it is the noisiest thing I ever heard. We bought a $17 air mattress that is made a little better and it is a great replacement. The frame has never collapsed on us and it seems sturdy, but it would be nice if they could put some sort of lock on it when it is set up. This is VERY comfortable to sleep on.
customer_reviews.author: Amy D. Sward

customer_reviews.title: heavy but compact, comfortable and convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for us to create additional sleeping space that is only rarely required. It is heavy, as other reviewers have indicated, but it is also compact in its case so it stores easily in a closet, setup is easy, and the zippered enclosure keeps the mattress from flopping around in an unbalanced way like it does when lying unsupported on the floor. Another bonus is that, since the mattress is separate from the frame until you zip it in, if later on the air mattress develops a leak, it looks like we could easily replace that part. SUPER HAPPY with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Air mattress leaks.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Feb, 2020 for this year's camping season. Unpacked it and set it up when it came, everything appeared to be working fine. Finally got out camping with it, this past weekend, Sept 2020. We had to re-inflate the air mattress every 2-3 hours as it kept loosing air. The cot is very comfortable when fully inflated, but it is not holding air. Tried to contact support, but it seems all support for the product has expired. I would not recommend this cot, the air mattress does not hold air.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Kuhn Yourdon

customer_reviews.title: Good, slept good, BUT what's up with the stretching label and having to fill it once a day?
customer_reviews.text: I slept very well with this cot/air mattress! There is a warning label that comes with it that says, "Please don't send it back, if it seems the air has gone out. The mattress needs to stretch" Ok, I'm not sure what the problem is but it definitely loses air! But, here is my experience. If any, it hardly lost air while i slept on it over night! The weird part is that it would lose more air during the day when i wasn't sleeping on it at all. I would fill it up every night and it would do fine over night as a slept on it. WEIRD! Used it on a 6 day camping trip last week.
customer_reviews.author: Motch6

customer_reviews.title: Solid cot yet terrible mattress
customer_reviews.text: 3 consecutive nights & my opinion thus far: The cot seems well made and solid for a folding design. The carry bag is well thought out and helps transporting it. The end table surfaces are just barely good enough to be useful. The mattress is the weak point. It sags when under inflated and It’s like rolling hills when fully inflated. Not flat at all, like who would enjoy sleeping on an inflatable topographical map? We substituted our memory foam mattress and it was so much better! We have old inflatable mattresses in our storage unit nicer than his one. I wish I could have purchased this whole thing without the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Human Person

customer_reviews.title: Better than putting an air mattress on a regular cot ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Better than putting an air mattress on a regular cot because this mattress zips in to the pouch to keep it from sliding. And better than an air mattress on the floor of your tent because tent floors get dirty and this keeps you above that. The cot is very easy to set up you just fold it open. The only downside is it's fairly heavy. Best to move it straight from your car to your tent and not have to carry it around. The cot also comes with a pump so you don't have to buy one. I didn't realize that and I had to return the pump I bought separately.
customer_reviews.author: Mdogs

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough for a geezer to like more than their bed.
customer_reviews.text: A+. Super easy to set up. Unfold it and the legs automatically go to the set position. Stuff the air matress in the cot, and remember to pull the valve "OUT/open" and inflate with the included pump. Once the air mattress is full, push the valve in to close it, then close the black bung hole plug. I've got the most picky granny that is absolutely OCD nuts, and they loved it. Very sturdy and the perfect height for a geezer to get into and out of. My geezer likes it better than their bed. Who would have thought? If only I could get my granny to stop sucking her teeth all day, every day, for the last 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Park Manager

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT !!!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this cot because you won’t sleep throughout the night. Any little move you will make it will sound like a volcano eruption. It is a big defect on the material Coleman uses. Do Not make the same mistake we did. Coleman should NOT have this cot on the market until they change the material they use. If I raised my arms would make noise, if I change sides while sleeping it would definitely wake me up and my husband next to me. Besides it came with a pump that wasn’t working properly, thus, we couldn’t sleep on it until we got another more powerful pump. Coleman should be ashamed of themselves by producing such a inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: ester wolf

customer_reviews.title: Love it.  Without this I could not go tent camping anymore.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love tent camping. We used to pack as light as possible and sleep right on the ground, but a few spinal fusion surgeries later even a nice double height air mattress wasn't cutting it for me. This, however, is so comfortable that we even used it as our nightly bed for a solid month while moving house recently. It really is fantastic and if you're going to spend your time in the typical "improved" sites found in state/national campgrounds then the weight and size of this wont be too big a problem for you. We also use it as an extra guest bed around the holidays when we have a lot of visitors.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kepler

customer_reviews.title: Full Sized Product in Queen Packaging
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a Queen Cot (78"x59"). The packaging says it is a queen, 78"x59", unfortunately for me, 2 days after the return date I realized it seemed small so I measured it. A Full size bed & frame were placed in Queen packaging. The bed & frame we received are 52"x72.5" We were not given the product we paid for. UPDATE: Amazon replaced it. We love the bed. Super comfy for my husband and me. He is 80 lbs heavier than me & it was not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Mar

customer_reviews.title: DEFLATED WITHIN AN HOUR! CANNOT RETURN THIS POS. agh!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this wanting to use it for when my inlaws arrived. We just tried to use it last night and the mattress does not hold air! It deflated within an hour. Now it is too late to return in - WTF, the closing return date was Oct 27th - they should still allow us to return it considering it is faulty....what a bunch of crap.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER

customer_reviews.title: Never managed to hold air
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 4th of July hoping to be one of the lucky ones who this worked for. Alas it just wouldn’t hold air for more than 4 or 5 hours at a time, super disappointing to say the least as we were camping for a week and it was a pain in the ass 😡 took a chance since we saw other reviewers say that the cot was comfy by itself when theirs failed to hold air and we found this to be true as well! Even so we wish it had held air because it is really comfy before it leaks out!!
customer_reviews.author: Fitrgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great camping bed.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bed if a bit heavy. Do the mole skin on the bars like stated in other reviews it makes all the difference. Kind of the pain in the butt but worth it. It's nice when your my age to sit on the edge of the of the bed to put your shoes and socks on instead of the ground. ;-) and it is easy to get everything back in the bag after use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not a camping cot but great spare bed
customer_reviews.text: Terrific bed! BUT. It is NOT light. This isn’t something you will be packing in and out of a campsite I wouldn’t want to take this where I had to haul it any distance. If the storage bag had wheels, that would really help. We use this bed as a quick bed for people staying over, if someone needs to stay with a sick animal out in the barn, or the like, where it will be up for a few days since it’s awkward to haul around. But it’s quite comfortable, easy to set up and take down, and it fits back into the bag. I’ve been very glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but effective.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together,inflate,and use. It is a nice quality product that I think will be durable. We haven’t used it yet but have inflated and set up to get the idea. It’s way too heavy and awkward shaped making it difficult to store and move. It also is very hard to get to fit back into the bag. The mattress itself did not come with a bag making it very inconvenient to store and pack
customer_reviews.author: KJO 24

customer_reviews.title: As far as air mattresses go, this is the bang for your buck model.
customer_reviews.text: Guests have never complained about a night of sleep on this. From the great-grandparents to the nieces and nephews, everyone has been comfortable. It sets up relatively easy, isn't horribly heavy (not light though), and had the right price tag. That said, the pump that comes with it is completely useless. The thing will be as sturdy as a wet rag if you use it since you can't get enough air pressure with it to really fill the mattress up tight. We ended up using a corded pump from a previous air mattress. Pair a supplemental pump with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ross

customer_reviews.title: Easy and comfortable - just a bit big
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble and pump up. Very comfortable. The only problem was that it is larger than I expected. We bought two cots for our children (9 and 11) to go inside one half of our 6-person tent - but it was impossible to fit two cots side-by-side into either half of the tent (the tent has a zipped divider in the center for privacy). We only had two options - both children slept on one cot (which worked) or one child slept in their sleeping bag on the ground without the cot (which negated the whole idea of buying two cots!). Good product but check your measurements first before buying.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this as it was something we really needed and could use on trips as well as when guests come over but it was just too uncomfortable for me. I used it on a trip to the coast when I stayed at a friend's empty house and I could not get to sleep on it. Tried it two nights, no sleep either night. We returned it and are appreciative of Amazon's return policy because with stuff like this, you just have no idea until you try it. Very simple to use, easy set up and has a pump. Even fits back in the bag when you're done with it. Just not for us.
customer_reviews.author: uncle jessie

customer_reviews.title: Solidly average
customer_reviews.text: A terrific concept - but in the end this is just an air mattress, albeit a pretty groovy air mattress. FULL DISCLOSURE: we used this 2 consecutive nights. The second night I did not re-inflate the air mattress before turning in. By morning there had been enough leakage that we had sunk together in the middle. That said, the first night's sleep was - OK. Had I added more air the second night perhaps there would have been a better outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore C Powers

customer_reviews.title: Great quality cot/air mattress.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality cot/air mattress. Nice, HEAVY, frame. It gives you extra room underneath so you don't lose out on storage space in your tent. I did have to add some more air each day, but I presume that was from the air mattress material stretching a bit. I presume that the mattress cover will need to be cleaned/replaced at some point, and I'm not sure how easy that will be. Luckily, it's big enough to be made like a bed with sheets and blankets, so your not resting directly on the cover.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Sleep like a princess
customer_reviews.text: We slept well and it stayed inflated. It folds up nicely but is a bit on the heavy side. I like how it all comes together in one bag with wheels so it is easier to move before it unpacked, however afterwards its just as easy to use the handles and pick it up. The side tables held a drink, keys and small stuff so it was sufficient. Once we remedied the cold air feel with a sleeping bag it was perfect! Its great for camping and also extra company at home when they drop by, it a solid buy and I do recommend the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K"s place

customer_reviews.title: Big heavy duty cot - heavy to lift but holds 500 pounds
customer_reviews.text: So it's big make sure you have huge tent to fit it in. Very heavy to lift, but easy to set up and take down. Sturdy and someone that is 300-400 pounds would feel safe on it. Not sure if the blow up would hold 500 pounds but it is very heavy rubber mattress. Bed is also long so a six foot person would fit on it. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth S.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have a bad knee and crawling out of bed hurts. We let the mattress air out for a week before leaving, so there was no plastic smell. Out camping the ground was very uneven so we dug a hole for two of the legs. Worked great. In five nights we aired up 3 times. It got down in the 40s and the mattress got cold. So we throw a extra blanket on top of the mattress then put our sheet over the blanket. Work perfect. Was almost like sleeping at home. Best camping accessory I’ve ever bought!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: deal changer
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. I have arthritis in my hips and knees. And my husband has 3 blown vertebrae in his lower back. But we love to camp. So one of our friends said to try the cot with air mattress. Only down side is mattress that came with is to thin. But we just use our old air mattress and it is like sleeping on a regular bed.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky noisey air mattress
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy but easy to set up. It is easy to inflate and deflate. It is noisier than any other air mattress in the face of the Earth. If you move they will hear it half a camp ground away. That plastic to plastic sound. Friends of mine bought the same one and between the two of us it was almost unbearable. It is loud enough to wake you up from Twenty or thirty feet away. I really wish I could send this back, but return shipping would kill me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kearns

customer_reviews.title: remarkabley comfortable for air bed
customer_reviews.text: Queen size. Slept on this for a week with little discomfort. Easy set up. Easy pack away. Used 3" mattress topper. Regular queen sheets stayed on just fine. Very little air loss over the course of a week. I did set it up a couple days in advance so the mattress could stretch and relax. Husband is 6'3" and really did not fit length well. Held our adult weight without problem - I'm a plus size woman. Did not notice much roll over noise like some buyers reported. The center support, head to foot - created a bit of a well on each side, so turning side to side was a little troublesome. Pump that came with, did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas H.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally bought this!
customer_reviews.text: This cot/airbed was in my amazon shopping cart for a couple of years before I could finally justify forking out the money. I'm very glad I did. My fiance and I (both weighing around 200lbs each) slept comfortably on it all night. The side tables are a nice touch. The whole assembly folds nicely into the carrying case with extra room to fit a couple of sheets in as well. It's been docked a star because the frame could benefit from an upgrade. If it snapped into place so that it could be easily moved when fully extended, that would make it perfect. Thanks for another great product, Coleman!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Melvin

customer_reviews.title: You may need a different air pump
customer_reviews.text: While the bed itself is nice; frame is sturdy and easy to set up, end tables are cute but small, mattress is good enough, the air pump is anemic. It barely has any pressure and it requires constant holding to work. It does not attach but just fits in the orifice. The pump will not completely fill the mattress. I purchased a hand pump to finish off the inflation. Reviews for Coleman small battery powered pumps are generally saying the same thing. Coleman replaced my pump but it was the same. The bed is fine....the pump is not.
customer_reviews.author: Larry R

customer_reviews.title: Best money I have ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews and said it made noise. It shipped to my house and I rolled on the cot without the air mattress to see what made noise and it was friction with metal and fabric. So I got Gorilla tape and took one half of the bed apart then taped metal frame that touched fabric. That problem solved however after the 3rd day of camping the air mattress was getting low and that made lots of noise. The bed is the best we slept on
customer_reviews.author: Campers

customer_reviews.title: Get it. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I am not as young. Could I do the ground? Yes. But why? This bed is a dream. We go camping every weekend, literally, in the summer, and this year, it was so much easier. It made a huge difference in my level of camping enjoyment. Easy to set up, easy to take down. The only thing we do that is a little more work, is to take out the mattress and store it in a suitcase with our bedding. Less likely to get punctured that way. My friend, though, has had hers for three years and just folds the mattress up with the cot, and it works for her. Worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We are camping enthusiasts in our 60's. We were getting tired of having to get up and down from the ground level. This product makes our lives much easier! Between a battery powered air pump and a foot pump, we can inflate this to exactly the firmness we want. It does a good job of holding air overnight, we just firm it up before bed and then we're good to go! I can recommend this to anyone who wants to get off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Steel-Perdue

customer_reviews.title: Air mattress failure - cot works
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have high expectations for an air mattress but I did hope it’d hold air for more than one night. I had back surgery and needed more support than sleeping on the ground. Unfortunately this mattress didn’t last past the first night. We couldn’t find any holes to patch. My back pained the consequence and I wasn’t able to attend many of the planned functions for the camping trip due to my sore body. Despite reinflating to capacity each nigh; we woke up on the hard cot. The cot frame does seem to be of good quality...
customer_reviews.author: Van Wittenator

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up the frame and the air mattress fit perfectly. Had to keep re-inflating the mattress, but that's typical of these things, so not a problem. Held my 185lbs without any problems - very stable. Loved that it kept me off the ground and, at least as valuable in tight quarters, provided great under bed storage for all sorts of gear. Only shortcoming was trying to use fitted sheets. The mattress is attached to the frame, so there was no way to tuck sheets in as one would with a normal mattress. Only thing that kept it from being five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: good idea
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea. The mattress, though, is just ok. It's the old kind that is more or less just a rectangular balloon, so it is not as comfortable as some others. The mattress fits into a sort of sack that is attached to the cot and zips closed, which keeps it on the cot. I'm hoping my higher quality mattress will fit into it. My only real complaint is that the sack that holds the mattress is not removable, but it an be wiped, and hopefully when the grandkids have an "accident" I can get it clean enough.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Bed quality great, mattress not so much
customer_reviews.text: Unless im using it wrong this thing is not as comfortable as my large air mattress. My back was hurting every time i slept on it. The base is very strong and heavy duty. Dont like the way it folds as fingers tend to get punched but thats a minor complaint. Most people complained about the sound as you roll over. The sound Didn't bother me at all. I would pump it up to the max and in the morning it would have leaked some air. The mattress feels cheap. Just not really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Russell

customer_reviews.title: Camping in Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for use on a three night camping trip with my wife who suffers from back pain. It was extremely easy to set up and a real pleasure to sleep on the cot above the tent floor in comfort. The only issue preventing a 5 star rating was the weight of the cot itself. It comes in a travel case equipped with wheels, but lifting and carrying it will require some effort. The mattress itself inflates and deflates quickly with the provided pump. It held pressure throughout the trip. Also, the end tables proved to be a real convenient place to store items that you need close at hand when you're sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C

customer_reviews.title: Great guest bed
customer_reviews.text: Had family that sold house and stayed with us for a month while new one was finished. the bed inflated fast, although not with the one that came with the bed, that one was under powered. did not leak air and was conformable. the had no contemplates while here ( about the bed) I give it 5 stares even though the air pump that came with it was under powered, ( it would inflate the bed, but took 10 Min with new batteries.I bought a corded pump for the bed.) but most beds like this have no pump to start.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Terry

customer_reviews.title: So Incredibly Loud
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bed for a couple camping nights now. I really like that the bed is off the ground. It was fairly easy to setup over the previous air mattress I had. The big issue of me not enjoying my purchase is the incredibly loud scrunchig noise whenever you move slightly in the bed or get up out of the bed. I'm going to try some of the hacks I've seen in the other reviews. However, as of now, I regret this purchase. If I bought it from a local brick and mortar store it would have been returned.
customer_reviews.author: vagabonding

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these disappointing busts. The air pump is super whimsy and you have to sit there and hold it to the air mattress because clearly no one can think of anything better to do with five minutes than holding the nosel of an air pump to the air mattress. I’m 220, athletic and sunk to the bottom of the air mattress in no time flat. Save your money and get a normal cot and put some type of foam or something on it. You win some; you lose some and I lost twice on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Rapier

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy and wont stay inflated
customer_reviews.text: I was going to use this, but it deflated so much that I let my 2 children sleep on it, 8 year old and 7 year old. Combined weight of about 120lbs. So I figured with that weight there would be no problems with it deflating but I was wrong every single day I was re-inflating. The noise is terrible, it makes so much noise it is not bearable and no one can sleep through the night with all the noise that comes from this bed. I wasted a lot of money on a bed I just ended up folding up and putting back in my trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. ChaCha

customer_reviews.title: Only air mattress one needs
customer_reviews.text: The only air mattress that makes you feel like you are in a luxury bed away from home. I don’t do canping, but when I had to go to family reunions with my ex husband’s family, we all were in the same house and for some reason, my husband and I never got an actual bed, and this Coleman allowed me to sleep like a champion. Well, plus Xanax.
customer_reviews.author: Cathatherine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camp bed!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this for our memorial day camping trip. I was originally sent the wrong item, but fortunately, the correct item was able to be sent in time for the trip. The cot is wonderful, it felt awesome to be up off the ground while camping. The air mattress blows up nicely and fits inside of the attached sheet. It comfortable held 2 adults weighing about 400lbs total. It was also nice to have storage under the bed in the tent. Tear down and set up were both easy enough for one person to do it.
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup? YES! Slow air leak? YES! Sex compatible? YES! :)
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used it on three trips with six nights. Super easy to setup and take down. The only negative so far is a slow air loss in the air mattress. It’s not terrible, just have to put more air in after a nights use.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great cot but air mattress is awful
customer_reviews.text: The cot is super if a little heavy, but the air mattress just won’t stay inflated the photo above shows the mattress after 4 hours, very disappointed. I’ve taken everything into account stretching, temp changes, making sure valve is closed properly etc. I’ve inflated the mattress 6 times all with the same flat results after a few hours. Coleman wants purchaser to go through them and by phone for returns which makes the process extra time consuming added to that shipping is on my dime. I will steer clear of Coleman for future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this several times now in our faithful Coleman 8 person pop up tent and it has been great! Very easy to set up if you've used cots before. If not, it's pretty straightforward and instructions are included. We have used both the Coleman 4D battery powered and 120V corded pumps with this and both worked great. If done properly the 120V will inflate the mattress in seconds and will deflate it over a couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: David & Shannon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I hate the sleeping part of camping because I can never ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute 5 stars for this cot. I bought another one. I hate the sleeping part of camping because I can never really get a good night sleep. I used this and it was amazing. You can move without it shifting on you. Tall enough where you are not struggling to get out of it. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel 9

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Oregon
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this purchase. The pump barely worked even with new D batteries. It deflated overnight, well, at least 1 side of the airbed did. The height is great. The side table is great. The airbed is not. I hate that in order to use this, I am going to have to figure out a way to inflate the airbed another way and hope it holds through the night. Or purchase a twin foam pad. Just so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pk Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this cot in the mail since my boyfriend and I camp often. I figured it would save space and the mattress would be comfortable and stay inflated throughout the night. I read so many great reviews as well. We just used it this weekend and we were so incredibly disappointed. It was so easy to set up and inflate but the fact that it didn't stay inflated was a complete disappointment. It didn't stay inflated for more than 30 min and now we are stuck with this bed. It's too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Works if you do not mind putting air in it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I am very displeased with this item. The instructions say that you will have to add some air to it after the first time you set it up, but I had to continually add air to it everyday. If I did it too early, then I would feel it sagging in the middle of the night. No reason someone should have to get up and out of the bed to add air to a air mattress made for sleeping. It had so much potential!
customer_reviews.author: T. Utz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but so noisy
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely sturdy bed that guarantees you won't wake up flat on the ground when the air mattress fails. The noise is significant and neighboring tenters heard every time we rolled over. Easy to set up. It is quite heavy but that's what makes it sturdy. Read another review that fixed the noise problem with three rolls of Extra Heavy Moleskin - 2" x 5 Yards applied to friction points. Would give it 5 stars if I didn't have to fix the noise issue.
customer_reviews.author: iclemartin2

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is awesome. I ended up floating my last camping trip so I got this bed thinking that I would be safer off the ground. I wasnt wrong! Definitely worth the price. Tables hid in a seperate small bag inside the big bag so I didnt find it until after the fact but thats ok at least they were there. And the mattress comes with it which I noticed not a lot of people asked about so I was worried it wasnt included. But it came with everything you need! Thank you for the awesome product and the minimal shipping time!
customer_reviews.author: Stephaine Goodman

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than home
customer_reviews.text: Wow - this is Camping? I can not believe how comfortable this is. On a long trip I camp by myself in a large very well ventilated Instant Cabin to have room to eat inside if bad weather or in mosquito country (on a short trip a Kamp-Rite Oversize single Tent Cot - one extreme to another). This works well in a large tent or as a portable bed for company at home. We use it for our grandchildren also when they visit. I am not compensated in any way for my reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Stein 3

customer_reviews.title: Great cot BUT mattress has got to go!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok where to begin. The cot itself is excellent and the storage bag along with pump and has both end tables bla bla bla BUT!!! I would recommend buying a new air mattress and using the old one for a pool floaty. After one night of hearing that nails on a chaulkboard popping sound of the mattress everytime you would move. I took the cot apart and wrapped bars in mole skin(bandage wrap) and didnt help. So i went to Target and bought a felt top Coleman air mattress for 29.99 (Queen) and that took care of the sound. Now its perfect no more popping sounds.
customer_reviews.author: cody romero

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Noisy but fixable!
customer_reviews.text: We love this little bed. We bought the queen for my mom when she came in town. It’s easy to assemble/blow up (make sure you pull the spout out first so air can enter). We put our super comfy queen mattress topper/memory foam on top and it made the bed extremely comfortable and a lot less noisy. If you just blow up the bed and sleep on it the rubber sounds is pretty loud but that’s expected when camping I suppose. Get a topper or follow some of the instructions from other reviewers for fixes. After mom left I was easily able to fold the bed and stand back up into its case. I definitely recommend this purchase 😃
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Great bed especially for company, but it's a two person job to get it up.
customer_reviews.text: I have this queen size bed and a single Coleman bed of the same design also. The single one I can put up by myself, but the queen size is a two person job just to get the frame up. I did it alone the first time, but it was not easy. After it was used, it was easy to deflate, but difficult for me to fold on my own and get back in the bag. I still recommend it, as it's so much better to have the mattress off the ground. My grandchildren jumped on it for a while before noticed, and it was fine, thank goodness.
customer_reviews.author: MayryChatt

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, nice guest mattress.
customer_reviews.text: We've had our picky mother-in-law (1 week) and friends (2 nights) on this thing both with positive reviews. The couple thought it was a real bed before we told them it was an air mattress. More solid than the tall, fully blow up ones with a built in pump. If the mattress or pump ever fails we can replace them but continue to use the frame. It's heavy, be warned, and awkward to set up, although certainly doable for one person. Also there is a bar which runs down the middle so no one's doing any comfortable cuddling on this thing. But it's there for sleeping and people sleep comfy on it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Fixed the squeaking!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this 3 years ago it was awesome and I'veade it even better so I'll write a review. This puppy squeaks like to no end until I spent $8 on a 50' roll of 1.5mm felt tape and applied it to the top and bottom edge of the frame work so now the canvas runs fabric not squealing across the metal. Best $8 I've spent in years.
customer_reviews.author: MUDDYPUNK

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleep at a Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was going to be a questionable purchase. BUT, it exceeded my expectations. We sleep on the deck at our Donner Lake cabin as much as possible. I’m 6’-3” and have some lower back aches and pains (68 years old). It’s a little bouncy but very comfortable. Needs a topoff every couple of days. The battery powered pump works great (cut the cord)
customer_reviews.author: bobfp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and Imused this just last night while camping. We absolutely love it. The mattress held air all night and was very comfortable. I'm 6'4" and 340lbs. My wife is a slender 5'4" and we had no trouble fitting on the mattress. It is heavy so should not be used for backpacking, just car camping.
customer_reviews.author: imwbd53

customer_reviews.title: Great! Easy! Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible! We ordered this for camping, being on the ground or low to the ground and getting up is hard on my knee. It came fully assembled, mattress was in great condition as well as the frame. Easy to set up, quick to fill the air bed and yes, it's comfy! I like how the mattress slips inside the building in cover. Keeps the mattress from moving around. Only issue we had was one of the side tables, the brackets were put on wrong and wouldn't extend. But my guy figured it out and fixed it. This will make a great guest bed as well!
customer_reviews.author: Shop_a_holic👍

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price - would get regular mattressless cots in the future instead.
customer_reviews.text: Took this beach camping in Kenai, Alaska and it was not worth it. Sleeping side by side was a nightmare so we had to swap to sleeping head to foot. Bought for cuddling but it deflated so fast overnight. Also, if either of us got up the other would almost fall out of bed. Splurged for the extra space since we also camp with a toddler who doesn’t always want to sleep alone all the time but this just really didn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Good for bad back
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable on my back, and I have a history of back & neck issues. Even though a single size, you don't need extra room because you don't need to "flop" & change positions. Only negative- it does lose air during the night. At 2 AM, I feel it. Too tired to get up & re-inflate. Maybe if it had a built in pump, it would be easier. The carry bag is nice, but gets heavy for a small framed woman to move around a lot.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cot so very much!! It was super easy to set up. I set it up by myself. First you just unfold and then snap the legs in place. Then just inflate the air mattress and insert into the sheet that is attached to the cot and zip up. I didn't know that it came with side tables so that was a pleasant surprise! It has a spot for a drink and a nice little flat area for phone, flashlight or whatever. There is one for each side. I would definitely buy it again. Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: kristina morris

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly comfortable. Giving it 4 stars for 2 reasons. 1. Bed needs to lock once opened 2. It's squeaky because it doesn't lock and the bed rubs on it. At the end of the day it sleeps 2 adults very well and comfortable in a tent. We put our flannel sheets on it and set it up just like a bed at home. Worked well and kept us warm on the lovely Montana "summer" night. Very happy so far minus the 2 things mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a camping trip just last weekend. I have back problems but love to camp. The getting up off of the ground from just the air mattress was not going well. I purchased this products and immediately found it to be a huge improvement. All three nights it was used it was comfortable and made getting up in the morning so much better. I am 5'10" and 250lbs and had absolutely no problem getting comfortable. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Schoenberger

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect camping bed. It is easy to set up and inflate. The cot is comfortable, even when the air mattress isnt inflated. We used to have an 18" tall air mattress, but it always lost air and took forever to inflate. This bed gives us a comfortable sleeping space no matter where we are at.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Ok for one. Needs reconsideration for two.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for camping but was unable due to the Rona. Tested at home: Set up easy: no bars to attach. Folds out comply. Inflation: quickly inflated. No issues Side tables: hard to attach but gives good bedside space. Comfort: one person my be ok but two is not going to work. *This may be due to just one night and the air mattress needing to stretch Coleman has always been a name of trust, value, and quality in my family. We are excited to see the improvement on this product!
customer_reviews.author: Julie H.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy. Mattress is uncomfortable. Theres a bar that runs down the middle of the cot.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Noise
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and inflate. Great ideas to have the matress inside a liner so it doesn't fall off the bed HOWEVER the matress moves on top of the stands and makes a very loud noise when you move in bed. Hard to sleep if you move at night
customer_reviews.author: No_public_name

customer_reviews.title: The only review you need to read. Great set up.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I used this for camping in northern Michigan and it was very comfortable to sleep on. We liked how easy it was to set up and the side tables where very handy. The double sealed air port was great and works with any air pump just have to pull it out all the way. The hight was perfect for normal people and we could sit at the edge and put on shoes. It was very easy to set up. What we didn’t like was that it didn’t have locking arms on it to keep it from folding up and how it folded up was rather annoying we’d rather have a long storage bag than a pinched finger.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Hole in mattress
customer_reviews.text: Hi! I bought this mattress a bit ago and then moved apartments. I didn't unpack the item and use it until the other weekend as i had friends visiting from out of town and needed an extra bed. We discovered as we were blowing up the mattress that it had multiple holes on the right side! We tried to tape it for the night but my friend still ended up with a completely deflated mattress in the morning : ( Please let me know how we can address this and thank you! Sorry for the late notice, I would have written earlier had i used the air mattress sooner. Thanks, Taryn
customer_reviews.author: Taryn A.D. Talmadge

customer_reviews.title: seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: great not to have to crawl off the floor. took a few nights to stretch out to full inflation. side tables are great and it is as comfortable as any inflatable. i don't think i would even have noticed the "squeak" if everyone else hadn't mentioned it--it certainly didn't bother us. what we did notice though is--the cold comes up through the bottom. we just got back from 5 days camping in vermont and it was well down into the 40's (maybe lower one or 2 nights) at night. in the future i'll bring a wool blanket or maybe a mattress topper to put under us if it's cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful buying for a temporary bed, b/c you're liable to end up just using this one.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a temporary bed until we figured out what we wanted for a permanent bed. We threw a feather "topper" on it (a thin mattress, AKA a "feather tick"). It's been nearly a year, and now we're just using this one. I have to put air in it every 4-5 months or so. I wish they made this in a slightly larger size, and we had to put anti-skid material under the feet to keep it from sliding (it's light and slides easily on hardwood floors) but those are my only quibbles.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Narby

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a basic cot or the floor.
customer_reviews.text: Second time using this for a camping trip. Still no leaks (and I have two of them in large family tent). Very nicely made. No complaints. Not a spring mattress so comfort is ok. But that is expected. Family slept well. Side tables easily hold bottles and book. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Smart one

customer_reviews.title: VERY Comfortable! Fantastic to be off the ground.
customer_reviews.text: VERY Comfortable. At age 55, it is Fantastic to be off the ground while tent camping. Wife and I love it! Yea, it weighs 40 pounds, but I can carry it in the included zip up case with handles - no problemo. The Included inflator/deflator works great, though in accordance with the instructions, you do need to fill it, lay on it, stretch it out, refill it, repeat, for it to reach a stable level of firmness when you use it the first time or two....
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Overall
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a good buy. I'm 5'10" @ 215lbs and it is sturdy, solid and comfortable. It doesn't make noise when you breath or move slightly. The only reason I took back one star is because when you roll over it sounds like your humping a beach ball in a plastic bag. I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Miner49er

customer_reviews.title: Noisy as heck
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea and the convenience, but we did not sleep well at all because every time you move the mattress squeaked really loud. The sound is a deep sounding squeak, but so loud, with every move you make. Even my son, in his own tent about 30ft away, complained about the noise. When you are tired ,or are around a group, it sucks to know everyone’s aware, when you make any move....ugh
customer_reviews.author: oliveforhealth

customer_reviews.title: Glamping at its finest
customer_reviews.text: This was great for getting up off the hard ground while tent camping. We had an 8 person tent with screened-in porch, and it was uncomfortable getting around with this taking up so much room. We will be getting a new tent to accommodate this beauty. It was nice having room under the cot to store our bags! It filled up quickly and stayed full after breaking it in. Queen size sheets were a tad loose, but stayed on just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Cup holders! You betcha!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize this came with little Hook on side tables and drink holders. Ironically the lack of drink holders is how our last air mattress popped so... that’s an exciting surprise feature. Love that the pump is battery powered. The air mattress sheet thing on the cot is super smart. I really only bought this for the cot but the upgrades are great. Drunk amazon shopping has never done me so good!
customer_reviews.author: kaitlynn

customer_reviews.title: Good mattress
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heavier guy, bought this cot and remember it's a cot with an air mattress so obviously it won't have the same comfort as the expensive bed mattress in your house, but it's far more comfortable than sleeping on the ground and just about the right height too, as with all air mattresses they do occasionally leak a little air as the stretch at first, first few nights I had to top it off with air after that it's been good to go, been sleeping on it in a tent in my driveway as part of a practice run for everything before I go on an extended camping trip
customer_reviews.author: joshua d.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed
customer_reviews.text: We took this camping as I cannot get up off of the floor any longer due to cancer treatments. I Loved this, it is is as high as bed and very comfortable. You do have to fill it a few nights in a row because of the stretching and yes the plastic does squeak when you roll over, but it is plastic after all. Loved that it actually fit back into the bag. The only disappointment I had was that it showed that you could roll up the bed, but says with only certain models, but does not tell you those models. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: koala63

product_meta.title: Coleman Camping Cot, Air Mattress, and Pump Combo | Folding Camp Cot and Air Bed with Side Tables and Battery Operated Pump
feature_bullets: 3-piece combo: Includes cot with side tables, air mattress, and battery-operated pump (4 D-cell batteries sold separately)
Superior support: Air bed's coil construction contours to body for better support
Leak-proof: Factory-tested to ensure air mattress stays firm all night
Sewn-in cover: Keeps air mattress in place on cot
2 side tables: Pull-out design for easy storage includes cup holders
Carry bag: included for easy storage
Versatile design to sleep indoors or outdoors
Airbed and cot for elevated sleeping support
Cot and airbed separate for double the sleeping space
Durable steel frame supports up to 600 lbs.
Two side tables with cup holders keep drinks and other personal items
Included 4D battery pump inflates and deflates airbed (batteries sold separately)
Airbed and cot fold easily inside included carry bag for compact toting and storage
For heights up to 6 ft 2 in.
Strong steel frame: Supports up to 600 lb.
Airtight System is guaranteed not to leak

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
